title: Tết Festival 2025
description: Join the largest Vietnamese New Year celebration in North America with traditional performances, authentic street food, lion dances, and cultural activities for all ages.

title: Heritage Photography Workshop
description: Learn documentary photography techniques while exploring Vietnamese cultural sites. Hands-on instruction covering composition, storytelling, and respectful community photography.

title: Literature & Memory Panel
description: Distinguished Vietnamese-American authors discuss how literature preserves cultural memory and shapes identity across generations. Featuring Ocean Vuong, Viet Thanh Nguyen, and Lan Cao.

title: Traditional Cooking Class: Phở Mastery
description: Master the art of making authentic Vietnamese phở from scratch. Learn to prepare the broth, balance spices, and understand the cultural significance of Vietnam's most iconic dish.

title: Voices of the Diaspora: Art Exhibition
description: Contemporary Vietnamese and Vietnamese-American artists explore themes of identity, migration, and cultural preservation through mixed media installations, photography, and traditional art forms.

title: Bánh Chưng Making Workshop
description: Learn the traditional art of making bánh chưng, the iconic square rice cake central to Tết celebrations. Three generations of Vietnamese cooks share family techniques and cultural stories.
venue: Hong Kong City Mall - Community Kitchen

title: Vietnamese Language & Culture Circle
description: Monthly gathering for Vietnamese language practice, cultural exchange, and community building. All levels welcome, from heritage speakers to beginners. Includes conversation practice and cultural activities.
venue: Powell's City of Books - Pearl Room

title: Modern Ao Dai: Fashion Show & Discussion
description: Celebrate the evolution of Vietnam's national garment with a runway show featuring traditional and contemporary ao dai designs. Panel discussion follows on fashion, identity, and cultural preservation.

title: Little Saigon Street Food Walking Tour
description: Guided culinary tour through Westminster's Little Saigon, exploring family-owned restaurants, bakeries, and markets. Learn food history and cultural significance while sampling 10+ authentic dishes.

title: Vietnam Streets Documentary Screening
description: Premiere screening of 'Threads Across Oceans,' a documentary following three Vietnamese families across three continents. Q&A with filmmakers and subjects following the screening.

title: Traditional Water Puppet Workshop
description: Rare opportunity to learn about Vietnamese water puppetry from visiting master puppeteers from Hanoi. Includes demonstration, history, and hands-on puppet creation workshop.

title: Community Oral History Project Workshop
description: Learn to document and preserve family stories through oral history methods. Training in interview techniques, recording, and archiving. Part of our ongoing cultural preservation initiative.
